Name: Poké Ball
Description: A tool used for catching wild Pokémon.

Name: Great Ball
Description: A good Ball with a higher catch rate than a Poké Ball.

Name: Ultra Ball
Description: A better Ball with a higher catch rate than a Great Ball.

Name: Master Ball
Description: The best Ball that catches a Pokémon without fail.

Name: Premier Ball
Description: A rare Ball made in commemoration of some event.

Name: Heal Ball
Description: A remedial Ball that restores caught Pokémon.

Name: Net Ball
Description: A Ball that works well on Water- and Bug-type Pokémon.

Name: Nest Ball
Description: A Ball that works better on weaker Pokémon.

Name: Dive Ball
Description: A Ball that works better on Pokémon on the ocean floor.

Name: Dusk Ball
Description: Works well if used in a dark place.

Name: Timer Ball
Description: A Ball that gains power in battles taking many turns.

Name: Quick Ball
Description: Works well if used on the first turn.

Name: Repeat Ball
Description: A Ball that works better on Pokémon caught before.

Name: Luxury Ball
Description: A cozy Ball that makes Pokémon more friendly.

Name: Level Ball
Description: A Ball that works well on lower level Pokémon.

Name: Lure Ball
Description: A Ball that works well on fished up Pokémon.

Name: Moon Ball
Description: A Ball that works well on Moon Stone users.

Name: Friend Ball
Description: A Ball that makes a Pokémon friendly when caught.

Name: Love Ball
Description: Works well on Pokémon of the opposite gender.

Name: Fast Ball
Description: Works well on very fast Pokémon.

Name: Heavy Ball
Description: Works well on very heavy Pokémon.

Name: Dream Ball
Description: A Ball that works well on sleeping Pokémon.

Name: Safari Ball
Description: A special Ball that is used only in the Safari Zone.

Name: Sport Ball
Description: A special Ball used in the Bug- Catching Contest.

Name: Park Ball
Description: A special Ball for the Pal Park.

Name: Beast Ball
Description: A Ball designed to catch Ultra Beasts.

Name: Cherish Ball
Description: A rare Ball made in commemoration of some event.

Name: Potion
Description: Restores the HP of a Pokémon by 20 points.

Name: Super Potion
Description: Restores the HP of a Pokémon by 60 points.

Name: Hyper Potion
Description: Restores the HP of a Pokémon by 120 points.

Name: Max Potion
Description: Fully restores the HP of a Pokémon.

Name: Full Restore
Description: Fully restores the HP and status of a Pokémon.

Name: Revive
Description: Revives a fainted Pokémon with half its HP.

Name: Max Revive
Description: Revives a fainted Pokémon with all its HP.

Name: Fresh Water
Description: A mineral water that restores HP by 30 points.

Name: Soda Pop
Description: A fizzy soda drink that restores HP by 50 points.

Name: Lemonade
Description: A very sweet drink that restores HP by 70 points.

Name: Moomoo Milk
Description: A nutritious milk that restores HP by 100 points.

Name: Energy Powder
Description: A bitter powder that restores HP by 60 points.

Name: Energy Root
Description: A bitter root that restores HP by 120 points.

Name: Heal Powder
Description: A bitter powder that heals all status problems.

Name: Revival Herb
Description: A very bitter herb that revives a fainted Pokémon.

Name: Antidote
Description: Heals a poisoned Pokémon.

Name: Paralyze Heal
Description: Heals a paralyzed Pokémon.

Name: Burn Heal
Description: Heals Pokémon of a burn.

Name: Ice Heal
Description: Defrosts a frozen Pokémon.

Name: Awakening
Description: Awakens a sleeping Pokémon.

Name: Full Heal
Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Name: Ether
Description: Restores the PP of a selected move by 10.

Name: Max Ether
Description: Fully restores the PP of a selected move.

Name: Elixir
Description: Restores the PP of all moves by 10.

Name: Max Elixir
Description: Fully restores the PP of a Pokémon's moves.

Name: Berry Juice
Description: A 100% pure juice that restores HP by 20 points.

Name: Sacred Ash
Description: Fully revives and restores all fainted Pokémon.

Name: Sweet Heart
Description: A sweet chocolate that restores HP by 20 points.

Name: Max Honey
Description: Revives a fainted Pokémon with all its HP.

Name: Pewter Crunchies
Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Name: Rage Candy Bar
Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Name: Lava Cookie
Description: A local specialty that heals all status problems.

Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Name: PP Max

Description: Encapsuled energy ups Pokémon with certain Abilities.

Name: Big Bamboo Shoot
Description: A large and rare bamboo shoot. Best sold to gourmands.

Name: Gimmighoul Coin
Description: Gimmighoul hoard and treasure these curious coins.

Name: Leader's Crest
Description: A shard of an old blade of some sort. Held by Bisharp.

Name: Malicious Armor
Description: Armor inhabited by malicious will. Causes evolution.

Name: Mirror Herb
Description: Mirrors an enemy's stat increases but only once.

Name: Scroll of Darkness
Description: A peculiar scroll with secrets of the dark path.

Name: Scroll of Waters
Description: A peculiar scroll with secrets of the water path.

Name: Tera Orb
Description: Energy charges can be used to cause Terastallization.

Name: Tiny Bamboo Shoot
Description: A small and rare bamboo shoot. Best sold to gourmands.

Name: Bug Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Dark Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Dragon Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Fire Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Flying Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Ghost Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Grass Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Ground Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Ice Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Normal Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Poison Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Psychic Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Rock Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Steel Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Water Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Adamant Crystal
Description: A large, glowing gem that lets Dialga change form.

Name: Griseous Core
Description: A large, glowing gem that lets Giratina change form.

Name: Lustrous Globe
Description: A large, glowing gem that lets Palkia change form.

Name: Black Augurite
Description: A black stone that makes some Pokémon evolve.

Name: Linking Cord
Description: A mysterious string that makes some Pokémon evolve.

Name: Peat Block
Description: A block of material that makes some Pokémon evolve.

Name: Berserk Gene
Description: Sharply boosts Attack, but causes lasting confusion.

Name: Fairy Feather
Description: A hold item that raises the power of Fairy-type moves.

Name: Syrupy Apple
Description: A very syrupy apple that makes certain Pokémon evolve.

Name: Unremarkable Teacup
Description: A cracked teacup that makes certain Pokémon evolve.

Name: Masterpiece Teacup
Description: A chipped teacup that makes certain Pokémon evolve.

Name: Cornerstone Mask
Description: Allows Ogerpon to wield the Rock- type in battle.

Name: Wellspring Mask
Description: Allows Ogerpon to wield the Water- type in battle.

Name: Hearthflame Mask
Description: Allows Ogerpon to wield the Fire- type in battle.

Name: Health Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base HP of a Pokémon.

Name: Muscle Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base Attack of a Pokémon.

Name: Resist Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base Defense of a Pokémon.

Name: Genius Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base Sp. Atk. of a Pokémon.

Name: Clever Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base Sp. Def. of a Pokémon.

Name: Swift Mochi
Description: An item that raises the base Speed of a Pokémon.

Name: Fresh Start Mochi
Description: An item that resets all base points of a Pokémon.

Name: Glimmering Charm
Description: A charm that will raise the shards from Tera Raids.

Name: Metal Alloy
Description: A peculiar metal that makes certain Pokémon evolve.

Name: Stellar Tera Shard
Description: These shards may form when a Tera Pokémon faints.

Name: Jubilife Muffin
Description: Heals all the status problems of one Pokémon.

Name: Remedy
Description: A bitter powder that restores HP by 20 points.

Name: Fine Remedy
Description: A bitter powder that restores HP by 60 points.

Name: Superb Remedy
Description: A bitter powder that restores HP by 120 points.

Name: Aux Evasion
Description: Sharply raises evasiveness during one battle.

Name: Aux Guard
Description: Sharply raises defenses during one battle.

Name: Aux Power
Description: Sharply raises offenses during one battle.

Name: Aux Powerguard
Description: Sharply raises offense & defense during one battle.

Name: Pokéshi Doll
Description: A wooden toy resembling a Poké- mon. Can be sold.

Name: Infinite Candy
Description: A unique candy that never seems to run out.

Name: DexNav
Description: A handy device for keeping track of Pokémon.

Name: Daycare Charm
Description: Raises the Exp. gained at the daycare.
